title: My parents want me to be among the top few students in my university class (undergrad). How do I make them understand that being above average in my class is just okay? - Quora

response.answer_text: Tell your parents that you need them to trust your commitment to excellence, and that you want the same thing they want, but while you have no control over how you’ll compare with the rest of the student body, there should never be any doubt in their mind that you are committed to doing your best. Then, repeat as necessary, “There should never be any doubt in your mind that I’m committed to doing my best.” If you don’t already have a tutor, and want the support of one for some or all of your classes, let your parents know that having one would ensure the best possible outcome.

You don't have to make them understand it, or reason with them on this. They may just be trying to push you as a psychological trick. You don't have to take your parents seriously (or anybody that doesn't make any sense.. unless they will impact you.. and then it's a question of how to deal with it)..
